availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Franklin West (Marshall County; 3rd Mtd. Inf CSA)

body.p: Marshall County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married Mary A. R. West. Farmer in Marshall County in 1860. Enlisted in the 3rd Kentucky Mounted Infantry Regiment (C. S. A.) on July 5, 1861.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, Unnamed District, p. 147; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, Briensburg District 7, p. 12; Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 90-1; Find A Grave, "Pvt James Franklin West (1833 - 1905)," Memorial #67778858, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=67778858 (accessed October 25, 2017).
